sen.j: 月桂院（げつけいいん、永禄11年（1568年）- 明暦元年（1655年））は、小弓公方家足利頼淳の娘。
sen.e: Gekkein (1568 - 1655) was a daughter of Yorizumi ASHIKAGA of the Oyumi Kubo House.
Gekkein (1568 - 1655) was a daughter of Yorizumi ASHIKAGA of the Oyumi Kubo family.
sen.cmt: House→family （用語集とは異なりますが、この場合はfamily と判断しました）
sen.e: Gekkein (1568 - 1655) was a daughter of Yorizumi ASHIKAGA of the Oyumi Kubo family.

sen.j: 名は嶋子（しまこ）あるいは嶋姫（しまひめ）・お嶋（おしま）。
sen.e: Her names were Shimako, Himahime or Oshima.
Her names were Shimako, Himahime or Oshima.
Her names were Shimako, Himahime or Oshima.

sen.j: 初めは倉ヶ崎城主塩谷惟久の正室。
sen.e: Originally, she was a lawful wife of the lord of Kuragasaki-jo Castle, Korehisa SHIONOYA.
Initially, she was the lawful wife of the lord of Kuragasaki-jo Castle, Korehisa SHIONOYA.
Initially, she was the lawful wife of the lord of Kuragasaki-jo Castle, Korehisa SHIONOYA.
Later, she became Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's concubine.
Later, she became a concubine of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
sen.cmt: a concubine として修正しました。
sen.e: Later, she became a concubine of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: お嶋は、関東管領・古河公方家の分家である小弓公方の血を継ぐ名門の姫君であり、秀吉の側室達の中では、もっとも高い家柄の出となる。
sen.e: Oshima was Himegimi (daughter of a person of high rank) of the Oyumi Kubo House which was a branch family of Koga kubo family, Kanto Kanrei (A shogunal deputy for the Kanto region) and came from the most distinguished ancestry among Hideyoshi's concubines.
sen.cmt: 古河について：単語リストにKoga と Furukawa が登録されていましたが、Koga のほうが正しいようです。
sen.e: Oshima was a Himegimi (daughter of a person of high rank) of the Oyumi Kubo family which was a branch family of Koga kubo family, Kanto Kanrei (A shogunal deputy for the Kanto region) and came from the most distinguished ancestry among Hideyoshi's concubines.
sen.cmt: a 挿入しました。House→family と修正しました。
sen.e: Oshima was a Himegimi (daughter of a person of high rank) of the Oyumi Kubo family which was a branch family of Koga kubo family, Kanto Kanrei (A shogunal deputy for the Kanto region) and came from the most distinguished ancestry among Hideyoshi's concubines.

sen.j: また、お嶋の最初の夫である塩谷惟久も、お嶋の喜連川家と同じく源義家の血を引き、源頼朝から､塩谷郡に役二万石相当の領地を与えられた名家の出であった。
sen.e: Moreover, Oshima's first husband, Korehisa SHIONOYA was descended from MINAMOTO no Yoshiie, same as Oshima's Kizuregawa family, which was granted the territory of about 20,000 koku in Shioya-gun by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.

Moreover, Oshima's first husband, Korehisa SHIONOYA was from a distingusihed family same as Oshima's Kizuregawa family, a descendent of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie and granted the territory of about 20,000 koku in Shioya-gun by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Moreover, Oshima's first husband, Korehisa SHIONOYA was from a distingusihed family same as Oshima's Kizuregawa family, a descendent of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie and granted the territory of about 20,000 koku in Shioya-gun by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.

sen.j: 天正18年（1590年）、小田原の役の後､奥州仕置に向かった秀吉が古河の方にやって来ると、お嶋の夫の惟久は妻の彼女を置いて逃亡してしまった。
sen.e: In 1590, after the Siege of Odawara, when Hideyoshi came to Koga for Oshu Shioki (approach to punish the powerful warriors in the area of Oshu, to prevent them from strengthening their power), Oshima's husband, Korehisa fled, leaving her alone.

In 1590, after the Siege of Odawara, when Hideyoshi came to Koga for Oshu Shioki (approach to punish the powerful warriors in the area of Oshu, to prevent them from strengthening their power), Oshima's husband, Korehisa fled, leaving her alone.

In 1590, after the Siege of Odawara, when Hideyoshi came to Koga for Oshu Shioki (approach to punish the powerful warriors in the area of Oshu, to prevent them from strengthening their power), Oshima's husband, Korehisa fled, leaving her alone.

sen.j: 夫に置き去りにされたお嶋は、その後､秀吉と面会し、秀吉の側室になった。
sen.e: After that Oshima who left behind met Hideyoshi and became his concubine.
After that Oshima who left behind met Hideyoshi, and became his concubine.
sen.cmt: カンマを挿入しました。
sen.e: After that Oshima who left behind met Hideyoshi, and became his concubine.

sen.j: お嶋は夫の塩谷家ではなく､実家の救済を秀吉に嘆願した。
sen.e: Oshima pleaded relief of her family home, not her ex-husband's Shionoya family.
Oshima pleaded with Hideyoshi to rescure her family's home, not her husband's Shionoya family.
Oshima pleaded with Hideyoshi to rescure her family's home, not her husband's Shionoya family.

sen.j: お嶋は､弟で足利義明の孫でもある足利国朝と古河公方家の義明の娘である足利氏姫を結婚させ､天正10年（1582年）の足利義氏 (古河公方)の死によって､実質的に断絶してしまっていた鎌倉公方系足利氏を復興させる事を、秀吉に頼んだのであった。
sen.e: Oshima asked Hideyoshi to let Kunitomo ASHIKAGA who was her brother and a grandchild of Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA and Ujihime ASHIKAGA who was a daughter of Yoshiaki of the Koga kubo family marry in order to revive Ashikaga clan of the Kamakura kubo group which essentially became extinct because of the death of Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA's (Koga kubo) in 1582.

Oshima asked Hideyoshi to let Kunitomo ASHIKAGA who was her brother and a grandchild of Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA and Ujihime ASHIKAGA, who was a daughter of Yoshiaki of the Koga kubo family marry, in order to revive the Ashikaga clan of the Kamakura kubo group which essentially became extinct because of the death of Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA (Koga kubo) in 1582.
sen.cmt: カンマを挿入しました。ASHIKAGA's→ASHIKAGAと修正しました。
sen.e: Oshima asked Hideyoshi to let Kunitomo ASHIKAGA who was her brother and a grandchild of Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA and Ujihime ASHIKAGA, who was a daughter of Yoshiaki of the Koga kubo family marry, in order to revive the Ashikaga clan of the Kamakura kubo group which essentially became extinct because of the death of Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA (Koga kubo) in 1582.

sen.j: 秀吉はお嶋のために､喜連川3800石の化粧料を与えた。
sen.e: Hedeyoshi gave Oshima 3,800 koku of Kizuregawa as marriage portion,
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Hedeyoshi gave Oshima 3,800 koku of Kizuregawa as a dowry.
sen.cmt: ”化粧料＝持参金”として修正しました。
sen.e: Hedeyoshi gave Oshima 3,800 koku of Kizuregawa as a dowry.

sen.j: 初めはぜひとも大変な名門の出であるお嶋に､自分の血を引く子供を生んでくれる事を期待していたと思われる。
sen.e: It seems that Hedyoshi really wanted Ohima who came from a distinguished family to give birth to his children at the beginning.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It seems that Hideyoshi expected Ohima who came from a distinguished family to give birth to his children at the beginning.
sen.cmt: Hedyoshi→Hideyoshi,really wanted→expected と修正しました。
sen.e: It seems that Hideyoshi expected Ohima who came from a distinguished family to give birth to his children at the beginning.

sen.j: 天正19年（1591年）に、お嶋の願いを聞き入れ国朝と氏姫を結婚させた。
sen.e: In 1591, Hideyoshi acceded her request and let Kunitomo and Ujihime marry.
In 1591, Hideyoshi acceded Oshima's request and let Kunitomo and Ujihime marry.
In 1591, Hideyoshi acceded Oshima's request and let Kunitomo and Ujihime marry.

sen.j: しかし、氏姫は気位の高い姫で、当時、わずか300石を有するだけの貧乏生活を送っていたが、「素性よろしからず」と秀吉の出自が低いのを見下したため、一時は見捨てられたような状態になった。
sen.e: However, Ujishime was so proud and nevertheless she lived in poverty with fief of only 300 koku, she despised Hideyoshi who came from poor family, saying that "He is of low origin", therefore, she was abandoned by Hideyoshi for a time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Ujihime was so proud and nevertheless she lived in poverty with the fief of only 300 koku, she despised Hideyoshi who came from a poor family, saying that 'He is of low origin,' therefore, she was neglected by Hideyoshi for a time.
sen.cmt: Ujishime→Ujihime,the, a と挿入し、クォーツ、カンマの位置を修正しました。abandoned→neglected と修正しました。
sen.e: However, Ujihime was so proud and nevertheless she lived in poverty with the fief of only 300 koku, she despised Hideyoshi who came from a poor family, saying that 'He is of low origin,' therefore, she was neglected by Hideyoshi for a time.

sen.j: お嶋のとりなしによって、天正18年に332石を与えられ、やっと貧困生活から抜け出せたという。
sen.e: Through Oshima's intervention, Ujihime was given 332 koku in 1590 and finally she could emerged from poverty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Through Oshima's intervention, Ujihime was given 332 koku in 1590 and finally she could emerged from the poverty.
Through Oshima's intervention, Ujihime was given 332 koku in 1590 and finally she could emerged from the poverty.

sen.j: お嶋は､秀吉の死去した慶長3年（1598年）､京都の東寺で出家した｡
sen.e: When Hideyoshi died in 1598, Oshima became a priest at To-ji Temple in Kyoto City. The following year, in 1599, she went to Edo and resided in Gekkei-ji Temple in Ichigaya.
When Hideyoshi died in 1598, Oshima entered nunhood at To-ji Temple in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: ”出家した”という部分を修正しました。Kyoto City→Kyoto と修正しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処(セルが分割されておらずそのまま2文になっていたので分割しました）
sen.e: When Hideyoshi died in 1598, Oshima entered nunhood at To-ji Temple in Kyoto.

sen.j: 翌年の慶長4年（1599年）に江戸に来て、市ヶ谷の月桂寺に住んだ。
sen.e: The following year, in 1599, she went to Edo and resided in Gekkei-ji Temple in Ichigaya.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
